page.title: 06HOME LIFE, THEBERTON
page.content: Although there is as much entertainment of friends in each others homes as elsewhere, perhaps it it is the bitter winter winds from the North Sea that are partly responsible for much activity in knitting, crocheting and in some cases spinning; but a country area is not only often concerned with animals for livelihood, but the majority of dwellings have dogs and cats and often other pets, amongst them a few horses for riding. East Green has more cats than children. Certainly a greater proportion of people in this area, as opposed to town dwellers keep more pets and practice more crafts. A telephone is more a necessity than a luxury. When the weather is suitable time is spent out of doors, kitchen gardens kept and homes well maintained.
